text: Haitham bin Tariq Al Said (, transliteration: Haitham bin Ṭāriq Āl Saʿīd; born 13 October 1954)Rulers is the Sultan of Oman, having succeeded his cousin Qaboos bin Said on 11 January 2020. He previously served as Minister of Heritage and Culture in the Sultanate of Oman.Appointing a Minister of Heritage and Culture, Royal Decree No11/2002, issued on 14 February 2002, published in issue 713 of the Official Gazette ==Succession== After his cousin, Sultan Qaboos, died on 10 January 2020, Haitham bin Tariq became Sultan of Oman. Oman state TV said that the Council of Oman opened a letter by Sultan Qaboos bin Said that he wrote before he died. The letter said who he wanted to rule Oman after he died. After that, they made Haitham bin Tariq the Sultan of Oman. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:Sultans of Oman Category:Current national leaders Category:Muslims
title: Haitham bin Tariq
